intro: Specklinia lingua, commonly known as the tongue fern, is a rare and unusual member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, tongue-like shape of the fronds, which are typically dark green and leathery in texture. The plant produces small, clustered spore sacs on the underside of its fronds, which are essential for reproduction. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its rarity and distinctive appearance, it is a sought-after plant among collectors and botanists.
